business.headline: Theobroma to be sold, Rs 2,410-crore sweet deal baked by ChrysCapital: ReportFounded in 2004 by sisters Kainaz Messman Harchandrai and Tina Messman Wykes, Theobroma began with a single outlet at Cusrow Baug on Mumbai's Colaba Causeway.

Claiming fake ITR refunds? Here's what could happenTo give honest taxpayers a chance to fix their mistakes, the department had earlier asked people to revise their returns if they had claimed any wrong deductions.

Filing ITR-2 or ITR-3? Check these common mistakes and tips to avoid themUsing the Excel utility for ITR-2 or ITR-3 seems easy, but it's easy to get stuck if you're not careful. One wrong entry can throw your entire tax calculation off. Here's a handy guide to avoid common slip-ups.

Explained: Why HCLTech shares are down 4% todayOver the past few days, HCLTech has been under pressure. The stock has declined 7.9% in the last five trading sessions, 9.58% in the past month, and over 14.6% in the past six months.

Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed  Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.
Sensex opens 119 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 176.33 points to 82,429.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.50 points to 25,145.80 as of 9:29 am.

Tesla's Model Y to debut in India at Rs 60 lakhIn comparison, the Model Y starts at $44,990 in the United States, 263,500 yuan in China, and 45,970 euros in Germany. This makes the Indian version one of the most expensive, mainly due to import duties and logistics costs.

Sensex, Nifty today: Inflation drops, but will stock markets rise?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,166 points around 8:22 am, suggesting a possible higher start for Nifty50, which closed at 25,082.3 on Monday. This points to cautious optimism on Dalal Street after four straight sessions of losses.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO allotment: Online guide to see status. Check GMPInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (also known as Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Bitcoin hits record $123,000 as US policy hopes boost crypto marketBitcoin is up about 30% so far this year and its rise has lifted other coins too. Ether, the second-biggest token, climbed to a five-month high of $3,059. XRP and Solana also rose about 3% each.

Retail inflation cools to 6-year low of 2.10% in JuneThis is the fifth month in a row that inflation has remained below the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) medium-term target of 4%, and the eighth consecutive month it has stayed under the central bank's upper limit of 6%
Sensex closes 247 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Eternal up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 247.01 points to close at 82,253.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 67.55 points to end at 25,082.30.

entertainment.headline: Stuntman Raju insisted on doing deadly car stunt despite warning: Actor VishalActor Vishal said the late Tamil stuntman Raju was advised against performing the car stunt that led to his death on July 13. The actor emphasised that the stuntman insisted on doing it.

Rajkummar Rao undergoes intense prep for Saurav Ganguly's biopic, shares detailsRajkummar Rao has confirmed he will play Sourav Ganguly in the upcoming biopic, with filming to begin next year due to the intense preparation involved. The actor shared that he's training to bat left-handed and called it a huge responsibility to portray one of India's most iconic cricketers.

Director Pa Ranjith, team mourn stuntman Mohan's devastating death, share statementStuntman Mohan Raj tragically died performing a car stunt for a film directed by Pa Ranjith, starring actor Arya. Condolences were expressed by actor Vishal and others in the film industry.

Jungkook, V and RM livestream together teasing BTS 2026 comebackJungkook, V and RM surprised fans with a rare Instagram live session after years. This hints at BTS's upcoming comeback album and rekindles excitement among the ARMY.

Four Years Later review: Shahana's series redefines Indian middle-class tropeRelease Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Four Years Later review: 'Four Years Later', featuring Shahana Goswami and Akshay Ajit Singh is streaming on LionsgatePlay. The Australian-Indian show delves into the complexities of a young couple's marriage and personal aspirations.

Jaws @ 50 The Definitive Story review: Steven Spielberg's shark saga still has biteRelease Date:Thu Jul 10, 2025The documentary 'Jaws @ 50: The Definitive Inside Story' dives into the legacy of Steven Spielberg's iconic shark thriller with rare footage and heartfelt insights, reminding us why 'Jaws' still makes waves.

Farah Khan says people celebrated Tees Maar Khan failure, felt they put her in placeFarah Khan shared that the failure of 'Tees Maar Khan' was met with open celebration by some in the film industry, with even former collaborators mocking her. Despite the backlash, she shared that the film has found popularity among Gen Z, who now consider it a cult favourite.

Travis Scott adds Mumbai concert to India tour after Delhi sells outRap star Travis Scott has announced another show in India, following the sell-out of his concert tickets for the Delhi show. Know more details here.

Kriti Sanon and rumoured partner Kabir Bahia cheer for team India at Lord's groundActor Kriti Sanon recently joined her rumoured partner Kabir Bahia at the Lord's cricket ground for the India vs England test. Bahia shared his picture with Sanon on his Instagram story.

Butterfly trailer: Daniel Dae Kim's show blends global espionage with slick actionPrime Video has unveiled the official trailer for Butterfly, a spy thriller starring Daniel Dae Kim. The series explores global espionage and personal betrayal, set to premiere worldwide in August 2025.

Harry Potter series in production: Dominic McLaughlin, and new cast details outHBO kicks off production on the new Harry Potter series, revealing Dominic McLaughlin as the new Harry. Cast details, first look, and fan reactions inside.

Prabhas watches Brad Pitt's F1 with bestie Prashanth Neel, fans spot the power duoActor Prabhas and director Prashanth Neel were spotted watching 'F1' at Prasads Multiplex in Hyderabad, with fan-clicked photos going viral online. Fans called them 'besties' while expressing excitement over the duo's reunion after 'Salaar'.

Sindoor before art: Anupam Kher's strong take on Diljit Dosanjh's Sardaar Ji 3 rowAnupam Kher voices concerns over Diljit Dosanjh's collaboration with Pakistani actor Hania Aamir in 'Sardaar Ji 3', questioning the implications of working across borders.

Ramayana's budget: Not Rs 1600 crore, Ranbir's film is Rs 4000 crore epic in 2 partsNitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana' is set to become India's most expensive film ever, with a budget crossing Rs 4000 crore for both parts. Starring Ranbir Kapoor, Yash, and Sai Pallavi, the film promises a grand cinematic experience with world-class VFX, AI dubbing, and music by Hans Zimmer and AR Rahman.

Producer Dheeraj Kumar hospitalised with pneumonia, in critical conditionVeteran actor and producer Dheeraj Kumar is in critical condition at Mumbai's Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital due to pneumonia. He is currently on ventilator support in the ICU.

Madam Secretary stars Téa Leoni and Tim Daly wed in private NYC ceremonyTéa Leoni and Tim Daly, co-stars of Madam Secretary, married in a private New York City ceremony after nearly a decade-long relationship that began quietly on the show's set in 2014.

First look at new Harry Potter revealed as TV series begins productionProduction has officially begun on the new Harry Potter TV series, with the first look at Dominic McLaughlin as Harry revealed. The new series, debuting in 2027, has a fresh cast and will follow J.K. Rowling's original books.

Richa Chadha condemns Radhika Yadav's killing, calls her father Deepak a loserActor Richa Chadha has voiced her outrage over the shocking murder of Radhika Yadav, allegedly at the hands of her father Deepak Yadav. She blamed deep-rooted societal pressures for the horrific act.

Dhanashree Verma, Yuzvendra Chahal's ex-wife, to join Bigg Boss 19: ReportIndian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal's ex-wife and influencer Dhanashree Verma may join 'Bigg Boss 19'. She is reportedly in final negotiations with the makers of the reality show.

general news.headline: Last hope for Nimisha Priya? Sunni leader steps in ahead of execution in YemenIn last-minute efforts to save Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya, who is scheduled to be executed in Yemen tomorrow for the murder of a Yemeni national, Talal Abdo Mahdi, talks are underway to convince the victim's family to accept the blood money in exchange for forgiveness.

Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed  Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.

Institutional betrayal: Naveen Patnaik tears into BJP over Odisha student's deathBJD chief Naveen Patnaik and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi assailed the ruling BJP over the death of the Odisha student who had alleged sexual harassment, calling it a "planned injustice" and "murder by system".

Theobroma to be sold, Rs 2,410-crore sweet deal baked by ChrysCapital: ReportFounded in 2004 by sisters Kainaz Messman Harchandrai and Tina Messman Wykes, Theobroma began with a single outlet at Cusrow Baug on Mumbai's Colaba Causeway.

Non-veg milk a red line in India-US trade talks. Here's whyAmid the India-US trade deal talks, Washington DC wants New Delhi to open its dairy market. But India insists on strict certification that ensures imported milk comes from cows not fed animal-based products like meat or blood. Rooted in religious and cultural sensitivities, India sees this as the "non-negotiable red line".

S Jaishankar meets China's Xi Jinping, first since 2020 Galwan clashS Jaishankar, who is on his first China visit in five years, said he apprised the Chinese President of the recent development in bilateral ties.

How Modi government's 4 Rajya Sabha picks signal shift in strategic templateThe Upper House of Parliament, often mocked as a place for defeated politicians or ageing notables, is being reimagined as an instrument of deep influence

Tesla India launch live: Mumbai showroom opens today, Model Y on displayTesla showroom launch live: Tesla is finally coming to India today with the anticipated launch of the Model Y SUV. The US-based EV giant has secured its inaugural showroom in Mumbai's upscale Bandra Kurla Complex.

Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz's luxe watch flex at WimbledonJannik Sinner left with his first Wimbledon title, while Carlos Alcaraz left with the runner-up shield. But both made it clear that in modern tennis, the scoreboard isn't the only thing worth watching.

Shux to splashdown today: All eyes on fiery re-entry into Earth LIVE UPDATESThe SpaceX Dragon spacecraft carrying Shukla and the multinational Ax-4 crew undocked from the ISS at 4:30 pm IST on Monday, beginning a meticulously planned 22-hour return journey.

Tum Kanwar lene maat jana: UP teacher's poem irks Hindu outfits, case filedThe poem emphasises the value of education over religious rituals. As the video went viral, Hindu organisations objected to the poem, claiming it hurt religious sentiments.

At Lord's, India's defiance crafts a tale greater than victoryEngland vs India, Lord's Test: Ravindra Jadeja, Jasprit Bumrah, and Mohammed Siraj fight to the last ball, turning a Test match defeat into a timeless saga of courage that will become a part of the legend of Lord's.

Trim, trim! Shux becomes first Indian to get a haircut in space.The picture of Shukla's space salon session, shared by astronaut Nichole Ayers, shows just how delightfully weird (and efficient) microgravity grooming can be.

Congress-led opposition calls for Odisha bandh over college student's deathThe coalition opposition, led by Congress, has called for a statewide shutdown on July 17 over the death of a college  student who set herself on fire.
Tesla Model Y: Bookings open but here is when deliveries will beginTelsa has launched the Model Y in India. We tell you when to expect deliveries of the same
Shux is coming home: Trailblazing return flight explained in graphicsThe departure from the Space Station follows a series of meticulously planned steps to ensure a safe and smooth return to Earth.

Zomato ad starring SRK, Jasprit Bumrah honours the struggle behind their successZomato's new ad video starring Shah Rukh Khan, Jasprit Bumrah, AR Rahman, and Mary Kom honors the struggle behind their success.

Hero or villain? Jadeja's Lord's stand with Bumrah and Siraj divides opinionEngland vs India, 3rd Test: Ravindra Jadeja faced 181 balls for his 61 not out on Day 5. The all-rounder stretched India's fight into the last session with his partnerships with tail-enders Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj. Could he have taken a few more risks?

Karachi-bound Pak man ends up in Saudi Arabia after flight goof-up, had no passportThe passenger boarded the wrong aircraft at Lahore Airport and only realised the mistake two hours into the flight when it became evident the plane was bound for an international destination.

Northeast improves on hunger, poverty parameters, a decade after Act EastThe latest North Eastern Region SDG Index shows that 85% of districts are now classified as Front Runners, with the number of Achiever districts more than doubling since the 2021-22 report. Mizoram, Tripura, and Sikkim are among the top performers, while 75% of districts in conflict-torn Manipur are high-performing.

Dark chocolates vs dates: Which is the healthier sweet for your pantry?When it comes to healthy eating, reducing sugar intake is often one of the first steps. So, when comparing dark chocolate and dates, which is the healthier pick? Experts reveal the sweet truth.

UK regulator flagged Boeing fuel switches four weeks before Air India crashThe UK Civil Aviation Authority issued a safety notice on fuel control switches on Boeing 787s weeks before the Air India crash. This raises concerns over oversight and aircraft safety compliance.

How Ganguly's iconic shirt-waving act inspired Jofra Archer's heroic spellJofra Archer drew inspiration from Sourav Ganguly's famous shirt-swinging celebration at the 2002 NatWest Trophy final to deliver a match-winning spell for England on day five of the third Test against India at Lord's on Monday, revealed England captain Ben Stokes.

sports.headline: Great for Test cricket: Jonathan Trott praises Lord's red-ball classicEngland vs India: Former England batsman Jonathan Trott has hailed the thrilling third Test in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, saying it was great for red-ball cricket.

Cricket at LA Olympics to begin on July 12, medal matches on July 20 and 29Cricket's highly anticipated return to the Olympic Games at LA 2028 will begin on July 12, with medal matches scheduled for the 20th and 29th of the month.

Jofra Archer silences keyboard warriors with heroic Test return for EnglandJofra Archer helped England seal a thrilling 22-run victory over India in the third Test — silencing the "keyboard warriors" who had written him off during his long absence from red-ball cricket.

Real Madrid complete full-back Alvaro Carreras signing from SL BenficaReal Madrid have re-signed Alvaro Carreras from Benfica for €50 million, bringing the 22-year-old full-back back to his boyhood club as part of Xabi Alonso's defensive rebuild ahead of the new season.

Heartbreaking, embarrassing: Chase after WI fold for 27 in shocking collapseWest Indies skipper Roston Chase has labelled his team's dramatic batting collapse against Australia in Jamaica as "heartbreaking" and "embarrassing", after they were dismissed for 27, one of the lowest scores in Test cricket history.

Mitchell Starc cherishes special week after historic spell in his 100th TestMitchell Starc starred in Australia's thumping win over the West Indies with a sensational six-wicket haul in the pink-ball Test. Celebrating his 100th Test, Starc became the fastest bowler to take a five-wicket haul in Test cricket.

Ben Stokes, England's heart and soul, is beyond the statsEngland captain Ben Stokes gave a jaw dropping performance in the Lord's Test match. Braving pain, Stokes bowled a total of 44 overs, in an effort that once again furthered his legacy as a true leader in world cricket.

Rishabh Pant's run-out the biggest turning point of Lord's Test: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar pinpointed Rishabh Pant's run-out as the key turning point in India's heartbreaking 22-run loss to England at Lord's, highlighting how it derailed a dominant partnership and ultimately cost India the match.

India could still win the Test series 3-2 against England: Sunil GavaskarIndia great Sunil Gavaskar has backed the Shubman Gill-led young side to bounce back from the Lord's Test heartbreak and win the five-match series 3-2 with victories in Manchester and at the Oval.

India stoked the fire, but England doused it and won sledging battle at Lord'sThe Lord's Test took on a life of its own when India decided to escalate the sledging battle at the end of Day 3. However, on the decisive days that followed, it was England who counter-punched-winning both the match and the war of words.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
